content.raw: In our deployment @ NIST we can’t seem to get consistent updating with 250 us triggers like should be possibly, but if the delay is increased to 18 ms  between triggers, it seems fine.  From Amilson who is the postdoc working on this he notes: “\(18ms looks familiar as the minimum trigger length for the _Extended Pattern Sequences_ - pg 43 user’s guide\).”  I am reading the DLP® LightCrafter™ DM365 Command Interface Guide, and I am concerned about the use of “Display Pattern \(0x04 0x05\)” to set the initial image as a static frame on line 332.  It seems that this might be moving the DMD into the Extended Pattern Sequence mode \(because it accepts frames with index up to 1500, which is the  Extended Pattern Sequence limit\).   I don’t have time to debug, but after sending the Display Pattern code perhaps we have to resend “Pattern Sequence Setting \(0x04 0x00\)”
